rComments: Easy grader. Very encouraging. Very approachable. You won't regret taking his Intro to Arts and Science class @Humber College. This is where he taught me in Fall 2019. Just show up, listen and do the in class assignments. I'm not sure another professor could make such a class so interesting & grade A-able. Go Humber for having him teach us.

Mark is the best teacher had the best experiences at Humber with him took his GNED101 and then ANTH205 classes truly a the greatest professor. Very energetic and interactive with the classes. Would select

It is very rare to come across teachers who genuinely, truly care about their students' well being as Mark does. His lectures are enjoyable and interesting, but beyond that, each individual in the classroom feels included and valued. His kindness as a human being knows no end. My only complaint is that his class is coming to an end!
Nothing posted online, be ready to show up to class and jot everything down. Fast talker which makes it hard to make notes. Watches a lot of videos which will show up on final exam.

MARK IS THE BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! In the past I have hated classes on sociology, anthropology and the like but Mark made the classes really enjoyable and fun. I am almost done my semester with his classes and I wish he taught more classes at HUmber that I could take!!!

So brilliant! And hilarious, engaging, and all around interesting. Anthropology wasn't my cup of tea in high-school but he makes it so enjoyable. The textbook is needed for this course but I'm not even mad about it, he makes me want to actually do the readings. Awesome prof.

I took this class online, as it was my second time taking an online course it was still a bit confusing. Mark was always easy to email and responded back really fast, he was also VERY understanding and a great person in general. Really laid back and provided me chances to help increase my grade with giving me more time with discussion questions.
He's a beautiful mind and soul. I fear I won't come across a professor as true and knowledgable as him again.

What can I say about Mark... He is the most incredible, most inspirational, most dedicated professor (no... human being!) I have come across in my years as a student. Yes, he is eccentric but that's only because he's beyond brilliant. I had him for GNED and ended up taking his anthro course. The best part: all of it. Worst part: that it has to end.

When I first met Mark, I thought "well he's different". However, it's different in a really, nice, unstuffy (if there's such a word) way. Certainly unconventional but quite a refreshing change from the norm, the mundane, the ordinary.  He is obviously brilliant. Would do another class with him. I'm just glad I got to sit in his class.

Mark is a wonderful person.  He is more concerned with learning and procuring  original thought than academics and institution.  I am extremely grateful to have encountered him in my journey.  Legend!
He inspired me. Yup.

Loved his classes. Gives a documentary/movie to watch every week. If you do the readings every week its much easier to understand his lecture plus his readings are usually short and interesting. A bit of work to get a really good grade but he keeps it so interesting that you wont mind putting in that extra effort

This prof teaches me at Humber College...Cultural Anthropology. He is an amazing teacher. He makes everything incredibly interesting. He values our opinions and he is a very cool person...and very HOT!!

I've never met a prof as nice as this one! First day of class, CLASSIC QUOTE, I will always remember. "I have never taught a  perfect lesson and you will never write a perfect paper. So let's get through this together..." He doesn't believe in buying books, book store is a sham. He provides all the reading, and picks the cheapest novels (for essay)

Nice/friendly prof. Slightly eccentric in a good way. Course is mainly writing and essays/tests aren't marked easy but do-able and you should get a minimum 70 if you study. Weekly quizzes are easy if you read. Movies are a bore and the Roy book was terrible but the course is good other than that. He's happy to discuss material, really good prof.

HANDS DOWN - best professor ever. I took this course last semester thinking I would fail my life away as I knew nothing about India and South Asia but he inflicts interest upon you when you go to class. I have never met a professor so compassionate and caring AND ACTUALLY WANTS YOU TO SUCCEED IN LIFE AND DO WELL. You must take this course! Loved it

Soooo amazing! Makes you feel warm and gooey :). Half of the class is just him talking about our readings and the other half is watching a movie :). He posts readings on Blackboard and they're not too hard at all! Really cares about his students doing well and is totally available for office hours. LOVEE HIM!!! Wished he taught more courses

He is the most amazing prof you will ever meet. He's soo helpful and soo very approachable. He cares about our marks and he knows we have lots of other work to do. He helps us in every way possible....and he is just sooo gorgeous that it just makes you want to go to his class everyday <3 LOVE HIM!!

Very knowledgeable and helpful professor. Did his field research project in India so he knows his stuff inside and out. Injects interest in the course material through the incorporation of relevant videos and documentaries. All in all, a top-class lecturer and a great addition to UTM.

You must take his course if you are interested in South Asia; even if you are not majoring in Geography.The documentaries were excellent and very insightful. He was also a concert musician and plays classical Indian string instruments! Very interesting professor,always kind, encouraging, approachable, and generous.Hope he teaches more courses soon.

Amazing Prof! Very helpful and understanding! was nervous going in becasue no slides are posted and lots of readings but every class was worth attending. He lectures for one hour and shows a movie for the next! all the movies were extremely interesting and all the content was tested on so if you go to class youll do great in the essays and tests!
